text: state of emergency in Russia schumacher
and critical condition and looking back
at the NSA whistleblower good afternoon
this is the New York Times minute with
just six weeks to go before the Sochi
Olympics Russia has declared a state of
emergency in the city of Volgograd a
second deadly blast this morning killed
at least 14 yesterday an attack at vola
grads main train station killed 17 and
wounded at least 35 and the world is
watching to see if seven-time Formula
One world champion Michael Schumacher
will recover from a medically induced
coma Schumacher suffered a serious head
injury in a skiing accident in the
French Alps over the weekend and remains
in critical condition and as part of our
look back at 2013's biggest stories
Edward Snowden's revelations while the
focus was initially on the 30 year old
whistleblower the glare soon shifted to
President Obama and the choices he's
made since taking office this is now
part of President Obama's legacy and
he's going to have to grapple with in a
very public way in 2014
